content: heartleaf birch hat by sarah rody i designed this hat because i accidentally cast on the wrong number of stitches while trying to knit a different pattern and didn t want to rip out all my ribbing there are written instructions and two forms of the chart the first chart has larger print with the legend on the next page and the second chart has smaller print and the legend on the right materials yarn about 180-210 yd 165-210 m of worsted weight yarn i used malabrigo rios and washted these are lighter worsted weights 210 yd/200 m per 100 g if your yarn is heavier you might run out of yarn if you are worried about running short of yarn you can opt for a single brim needles size us 6 4 mm needles or whatever size is needed to make gauge 16-inch circulars and double-pointed needles or your preferred method of medium- and small- circumference knitting in the round size us 4 3 5 mm needles or 1-2 sizes smaller than your main needles 16-inch circulars for knitting the brim ribbing gauge 20 stitches and 27 row in 4 in x 4 in 10 cm x 10 cm of stockinette using the larger needles sizing this hat fits my 22-inch 56 cm head quite nicely due to the stretch of the cables and ribbing stitch i think it would fit about 20-24 inches 51-61 cm to adjust the length you could change the gauge change the length of the ribbing or add or subtract a pattern repeat my finished hat is about 11 inches deep unfolded many testers preferred to omit a pattern repeat pattern cast on 100 stitches using the smaller needles and either the twisted german/old norwegian cast-on https //www interweave com/article/knitting/old-norwegian-cast-on/ - my favorite for a folded brim because i think it looks nice from the reverse the long tail cast-on or your favorite stretchy cast-on for ribbing join in the round and knit in 2x2 ribbing for 3 5 inches 9 cm approximately 25 rounds for a folded brim or 1 5 inches 3 8 cm for a non-folded brim 2x2 ribbing *k2 p2* repeat until the end of the round change to larger needles and begin on round 2 the increase round of the charts or written instructions round 1 references the last round of ribbing you will repeat the chart 5 times around change to small-circumference needles when necessary after the last round cut the yarn leaving an 8-inch tail and thread it through the remaining 10 stitches twice weave in ends 1 written instructions last row of ribbing round 1 *k2 p2* repeat until the end of the round 100 st body round 2 *k2 p2 k2 p1 m1p p1 k2 p2 rli k2 lli p2 k2 p1 m1p p1* repeat 120 st round 3 + all odd rounds through 27 knit in established pattern knit the knits and purl the purls round 4 *k2 p2 k2 p3 k2 p2 c4b
